trends: There have been 91 other sightings in London
There was one other sighting in London on or around September 27th 2008
divs: sighting detailsrecently moved to property (ground floor apartment) in palmers green, london. went outside to communal back garden around midnight to 1am to have a cigarette. the sky is unobscured by any buildings and i'm guessing the property is relatively near to an airport as theres usually a number of commercial airliners at high-medium altitudes crossing the sky - am very used to seeing them. at this point, i noticed an unusually bright and orange coloured light making it's way toward the property from the horizon, to my right. it seemed to be fairly low in altitude and i initially thought it to be a helicopter\small plane. however the sky was relatively clear and i could not make out any recognisable details. it flew a little too slowly and on a straight course overhead. (around 3 minutes) i lost sight of it as it became visually obscured by the roof of the three storey property. it made no noise. around 20 seconds later a second appeared following the same trajectory. at this point i thought that planes could not fly on the same "path" so closely? again with 20 second intervals, 2 more orange glows (couldn't make out a shape) followed. the fifth and last had a much steeper trajectory of ascent - closer to that of a rocket.(from my perspective) i was able to scrutinize this one very well as i had walked around "behind" to get the best look i could. whilst i am not 100%, it appeared that the light was emitting from the front-half, whilst the form behind the light appeared to be rounded. one week later, on the 5th november(bonfire night)at 10.30pm i saw the exact same objects in the sky, although this time there were only two. the sky was cloudier this night than the first. it was up to my left, a little lower than the previous sighting (at a helicopter altitude) and continued to move very slowly to the left and away from me. (around 2 minutes) it began to fade gradually and entirely dissapear (this may have been due to cloud cover) (fading around 30 seconds) a second appeared again 20 seconds or so later and followed the same path. i didn't want to lose sight of it and didn't think i would have time to find my camera inside. i watched it very closely and noticed there were subtle nuances in its movement. for around 1 second it actually reversed. again this one gradually disappeared (the glow became smaller) like the first and i lost it. *additional details apply to first sighting*
